page.title: 20FARMING
page.content: Croft House Farm is on the main street of Ireby. It is stone built and is 216 years old. The buildings consist of a calf shed, three byres, a barn and a dutch barn (both used for storing hay) and 2 lofts also used for storing hay. There is a third loft which is used for storing barley and a meal house where we store the animals food. We also have an implement shed where we keep all the implements that can't be left out in the rain. The implement shed is situated on an acre or so of land called a garth. This is where we also keep our big bales. We have 80 sheep of various breeds. We also have 80 cows but we are only milking 23.We have 16 calves all feeding from the bucket. We have three tractors, all Fords. We sell milk and vegetables.
